title: Monolith to Microservices: Evolutionary Patterns to Transform Your Monolith
author: Sam Newman
description: How do you detangle a monolithic system and migrate it to a microservice architecture? How do you do it while maintaining business-as-usual? As a companion to Sam Newman’s extremely popular Building Microservices, this new book details a proven method for transitioning an existing monolithic system to a microservice architecture.

title: AI and Machine Learning for Coders: A Programmer's Guide to Artificial Intelligence
author: Laurence Moroney
description: Welcome to AI and Machine Learning for Coders, a book that I’ve been wanting to write for many years but that has only really become possible due to recent advances in machine learning (ML) and, in particular, TensorFlow. The goal of this book is to prepare you, as a coder, for many of the scenarios that you can address with machine learning, with the aim of equipping you to be an ML and AI developer without needing a PhD! I hope that you’ll find it useful, and that it will empower you with the confidence to get started on this wonderful and rewarding journey.

title: Begin to Code with JavaScript
author: Rob Miles
description: Start programming with this friendly, full-color book designed for absolute beginners. Learn by building real projects with interactive JavaScript samples right in your browser. Whether you're new or have tried before, this guide puts the fun and power of coding in your hands!

title: Building a Career in Cybersecurity: The Strategy and Skills You Need to Succeed
author: Yuri Diogenes
description: Cybersecurity is one of the world's fastest growing, most exciting fields--but that doesn't mean it's easy to enter the industry and succeed. Now there's a complete guide to creating a great cybersecurity career, whether you're migrating to cybersecurity from another field or already a cybersecurity professional.

title: Building an API Product: Design, implement, release, and maintain API products that meet user needs
author: Bruno Pedro
description: Unlock the power of APIs with expert guidance and techniques for successfully creating, testing, and maintaining products that align with customers and stand out in the market

title: C# and Algorithmic Thinking for the Complete Beginner Learn to Think Like a Programmer
author: Aristides Bouras
description: Fully updated for the latest C#, this book is a beginner-friendly introduction to programming. It focuses on building strong Algorithmic Thinking skills—teaching problem-solving through coding for anyone eager to learn C# from scratch.

title: Certified Information Security Manager Exam Prep Guide - Second Edition
author: Hemang Doshi
description: Purchase of the book unlocks access to web-based tools like practice questions, flashcards, and more to take your CISM prep to the next level.

title: C# Interview Guide: Boost your confidence with answers to hundreds of secret interview questions
author: Konstantin Semenenko
description: Catapult your C# journey with this guide to crafting standout resumes, mastering advanced concepts, and navigating job offers with real-world insights for unparalleled success in programming and interviews

title: Cloud Penetration Testing: Learn how to effectively pentest AWS, Azure, and GCP applications
author: Kim Crawley
description: Get to grips with cloud exploits, learn the fundamentals of cloud security, and secure your organization's network by pentesting AWS, Azure, and GCP effectively

title: C++ Without Fear: A Beginner's Guide That Makes You Feel Smart
author: Brian Overland
description: Want to learn programming and C++, the language behind top games and software? C++ Without Fear, Third Edition is perfect for beginners, updated for C++14 and Microsoft Visual C++ Community Edition to get you coding quickly—even with no prior experience!

title: Cybersecurity Blue Team Strategies
author: Kunal Sehgal, Nikolaos Thymianis
description: This book is for cybersecurity professionals defending systems against attacks, including penetration testers, analysts, security leaders, and blue team members. CISOs securing their organizations will also benefit. Basic IT security knowledge is recommended.

title: Cyber Threat Intelligence: The No-Nonsense Guide for Cisos and Security Managers
author: Aaron Roberts
description: Learn how to establish a successful cyber threat intelligence (CTI) practice within your security team. This book explains how collecting and analyzing threat data helps protect your organization by enabling proactive, intelligence-led security measures that prevent attacks rather than just respond to them.

title: Deep Learning for Coders with Fastai and PyTorch: AI Applications Without a PhD
author: Jeremy Howard & Sylvain Gugger
description: Deep learning is often viewed as the exclusive domain of math PhDs and big tech companies. But as this hands-on guide demonstrates, programmers comfortable with Python can achieve impressive results in deep learning with little math background, small amounts of data, and minimal code. How? With fastai, the first library to provide a consistent interface to the most frequently used deep learning applications.

title: Functional Programming in JavaScript
author: Luis Atencio
description: Functional Programming in JavaScript teaches JavaScript developers functional techniques that will improve extensibility, modularity, reusability, testability, and performance. Through concrete examples and jargon-free explanations, this book teaches you how to apply functional programming to real-life development tasks

title: The Power of Generative AI for Object-Oriented Software Engineering with UML
author: Jim Arlow & Ila Neustadt
description: Generative AI is transforming software engineering by automating coding and changing required skills. Software professionals must now create precise analysis artifacts for AI code generation. Generative analysis offers a clear, structured approach to thrive in this AI-driven engineering landscape.

title: Generative Deep Learning: Teaching Machines to Paint, Write, Compose, and Play
author: David Foster
description: Generative modeling is a hot AI topic, enabling machines to excel in painting, writing, and music. This practical book guides machine-learning engineers and data scientists in building powerful generative models like variational autoencoders, GANs, encoder-decoder models, and world models.

title: Get Programming with JavaScript
author: John Larsen
description: Ready to create web apps, games, and programs? Get Programming with JavaScript is a hands-on guide for absolute beginners. With clear examples, exercises, and no special tools needed, you'll learn to code using just your text editor and browser, plus live online demos to follow along.

title: Practical Exercises on the Computational Subjects You Keep Avoiding (Like C)
author: Zed Shaw
description: In Learn C the Hard Way, you’ll complete 52 hands-on exercises with Zed Shaw’s videos. Type the code yourself, fix errors, and watch programs run. You’ll learn modern C programming, improve problem-solving skills, and master defensive coding techniques to build secure, reliable software.

title: GraphQL Best Practices
author: Artur Czemiel
description: In the ever-evolving landscape of web development, GraphQL has emerged as a powerful query language that addresses the limitations of traditional REST APIs. This guide delves deep into GraphQL, starting with its foundational principles and swiftly advancing to complex topics that will equip you with the skills you need to understand this technology.

title: Ghidra Software Reverse Engineering for Beginners: Analyze, identify, and avoid malicious code and potential threats in your networks and systems
author: David Álvarez Pérez

title: Low-Code AI: A Practical Project-Driven Introduction to Machine
author: Gwendolyn Stripling & Michael Abel
description: Take a data-first and use-case-driven approach with Low-Code AI to understand machine learning and deep learning concepts. This hands-on guide presents three problem-focused ways to learn no-code ML using AutoML, low-code using BigQuery ML, and custom code using scikit-learn and Keras. In each case, you'll learn key ML concepts by using real-world datasets with realistic problems.

title: Microsoft Azure Network Security
author: Nicholas Dicola & Anthony Roman
description: Network security is crucial to safely deploying and managing Azure cloud resources in any environment. Now, two of Microsoft's leading experts present a comprehensive, cloud-native approach to protecting your network, and safeguarding all your Azure systems and assets. Nicholas DiCola and Anthony Roman begin with a thoughtful overview of network security's role in the cloud. Next, they offer practical, real-world guidance on deploying cloud-native solutions for firewalling, DDOS, WAF, and other foundational services - all within a best-practice secure network architecture based on proven design patterns.

title: Practical Cybersecurity Architecture: A guide to creating and implementing robust designs for cybersecurity architects
author: Ed Moyle & Diana Kelley
description: Cybersecurity architects collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and design implementable, goal-driven security solutions aligned with organizational governance.

title: PostgreSQL: Up and Running: A Practical Guide to the Advanced Open Source Database
author: Regina O. Obe & Leo S. Hsu
description: Thinking of migrating to PostgreSQL? This clear, fast-paced introduction helps you understand and use this open source database system. Not only will you learn about the enterprise class features in versions 9.5 to 10, you will also discover that PostgeSQL is more than a database system, it is an impressive application platform as well.

title: Programming APIs with C# and .NET: Develop high-performance APIs that ensure seamless application communication and enhanced security
author: Jesse Liberty & Joseph Dluzen

title: Quick Start Guide to Large Language Models: Strategies and Best Practices for Using ChatGPT and Other LLMs
author: Sinan Ozdemir
description: Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT are demonstrating breathtaking capabilities, but their size and complexity have deterred many practitioners from applying them. In Quick Start Guide to Large Language Models, pioneering data scientist and AI entrepreneur Sinan Ozdemir clears away those obstacles and provides a guide to working with, integrating, and deploying LLMs to solve practical problems.

title: Rails Crash Course: A No-Nonsense Guide to Rails Development
author: Anthony Lewis
description: Rails is a robust, flexible development platform that lets you build complex websites quickly. Major websites like GitHub, Hulu, and Twitter have run Rails under the hood, and if you know just enough HTML and CSS to be dangerous, Rails Crash Course will teach you to harness Rails for your own projects and create web applications that are fast, stable, and secure.

title: React Hooks in Action: With Suspense and Concurrent Mode
author: John Larsen
description: Create sleek, fast-loading user interfaces in React without custom classes. React Hooks let you manage state, lifecycle, and side effects in functional components. React Hooks in Action guides you through using hooks like useState, useReducer, and useEffect to build reusable, efficient code and become a more effective React developer.

title: Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces
author: Remzi H. Arpaci-Dusseau & Andrea C. Arpaci-Dusseau
description: OSTEP ('Oh Step'), or the 'the comet book', is a widely used textbook that introduces key concepts in Operating Systems in an accessible way. Organized into three sections—virtualization, concurrency, and persistence—this book provides students and professionals with a clear understanding of OS principles. Written by professors at the University of Wisconsin–Madison, it blends academic rigor with practical clarity.

title: Ruby on Rails Tutorial: Learn Web Development with Rails
author: Michael Hartl
description: Used by Hulu, GitHub, Shopify, and Airbnb, Ruby on Rails is a leading web development framework. Whether you're new to web development or just Rails, Ruby on Rails™ Tutorial, Seventh Edition is the perfect guide to get you started.

title: Ruby by Example: Concepts and Code
author: Kevin C. Baird
description: There may be no better way to learn how to program than by dissecting real, representative examples written in your language of choice. Ruby by Example analyzes a series of Ruby scripts, examining how the code works, explaining the concepts it illustrates, and showing how to modify it to suit your needs. Baird's examples demonstrate key features of the language (such as inheritance, encapsulation, higher-order functions, and recursion), while simultaneously solving difficult problems (such as validating XML, creating a bilingual program, and creating command-line interfaces).

title: Beginning C++ Game Programming: Learn C++ from scratch by building fun games
author: John Horton
description: Always dreamed of creating your own games? Beginning C++ Game Programming, 3rd Edition helps you make that dream real! Updated with VS 2022, SFML, and modern C++20, this beginner-friendly guide walks you through building four fully playable games—from Timberman and Pong to a zombie survival shooter and an endless runner.

title: Securing 5G and Evolving Architectures
author: Pramod Nair
description: Securing 5G and Evolving Architectures is for technical and management audiences at all levels of 5G experience---from enterprise and security architects to network engineers, cloud computing and data center professionals, to CSO and CTO teams.

title: The C++ Workshop: Learn to write clean, maintainable code in C++ and advance your career in software engineering
author: Dale Green, Kurt Guntheroth & Shaun Ross Mitchell

title: C++ High Performance: Master the art of optimizing the functioning of your C++ code
author: Bjorn Andrist, Viktor Sehr & Ben Garney
description: A comprehensive guide for C++ developers to boost app performance by making them faster and more resource-efficient. C++ High Performance, Second Edition teaches you how to optimize your code without sacrificing readability.

title: Simplifying JavaScript: Writing Modern JavaScript with ES5, ES6, and Beyond
author: Joe Morgan
description: The best modern JavaScript is simple, readable, and predictable. This guide teaches you to write better code through practical examples—not just syntax memorization. Learn how modern features like clear variable declarations, array methods, curried functions, and classes lead to cleaner, more expressive, and less error-prone code.

title: Spring Boot 3.0 Cookbook: Proven recipes for building modern and robust Java web applications with Spring Boot
author: Felip Miguel Puig

title: Pentesting API's: A practical guide to discovering, fingerprinting and exploting API's
author: Mauricio Harley
description: This book begins by establishing a foundational understanding of APIs, particularly focusing on REST and GraphQL, emphasizing their critical role and potential security vulnerabilities. It guides you through setting up a penetration testing environment to ensure the practical application of concepts.

title: Shell Programming in Unix, Linux and OS X - Fourth Edition
author: Stephen G. Kochan & Patrick Wood
frontpage: Shell Programming in Unix, Linux and OS X - Fourth Edition.jpg
description: This thoroughly revised fourth edition presents shell scripting across major Unix-based systems including Linux, macOS (OS X), and Solaris. It guides readers through essential concepts like variables, control structures, functions, debugging, and advanced features such as regular expressions and shell environment customization. Suitable for both beginners and seasoned users.

title: TCP-IP Illustrated, Volume 1 The Protocols, Second Edition
author: W. Richard Stevens & Kevin R. Fall
frontpage: TCP-IP Illustrated, Volume 1 The Protocols, Second Edition.jpg
description: An updated, richly illustrated and deeply technical guide to the TCP/IP protocol suite. Building on Stevens’ classic first edition, Kevin R. Fall expands coverage to modern networking topics—IPv6, DHCP, NAT, firewalls, security protocols, and more—using real-world examples and packet traces to show how protocols function and why.
